results.title: Old person's friend
results.creator_credit: Annie O'Donoghue, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. An elderly woman, bedridden and with a history of strokes, refuses medical attention and creates a dilemma for the hospital’s staff. Should she be allowed to die as she wishes or should everything possible be done to preserve life?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Annie O’Donoghue, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and ONF | NFB

results.title: Old masters, new visions: from the Phillips Collection
results.creator_credit: Robert Walker, Steve Isaac, Australian National Gallery and Australian Capital TV
results.brief_description: This video features a selection from the 71 works exhibited as the “Old Masters-New Visions” exhibition, from the Phillips Collection, Washington DC, at the Australian National Gallery, Canberra, the Art Gallery of Western Australia, Perth and the Art Gallery of South Australia, Adelaide. The video was shot in the Australian National Gallery and features the works of El Greco, Goya, Chardin, Ingres, Constable, Courbet, Monet, Cezanne, Renoir, Van Gogh, Rousseau, Marc, Kandinsky, Bonnard, Braque, Matisse and Rothko.
results.title_for_label: Old masters, new visions: from the Phillips Collection
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Walker, Steve Isaac, Australian National Gallery and Australian Capital TV

results.title: Old man: returning to Lake Condah Mission
results.brief_description: This is a documentary film about growing up on Lake Condah Aboriginal Mission. A local Elder, Uncle Kenny Saunders, visits the site of Lake Condah Mission and talks about his childhood memories revealing a past of cruelty and fear, and the devastation felt in the aftermath of the Eumerella massacres.

results.title: Old man possum
results.brief_description: Gives details of the animal, its characteristics and its food habits. Compares the Australian marsupial with the American opossum. Shows types of possums, including gliding phalangers of all sizes, the ring-tailed possum, the cuscus and many others. Also shows the research work on the physiology of marsupials being carried out on the brush-tailed possum at Sydney University.

results.title: Old life, new life
results.creator_credit: Raelanah Loloa, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: For Raelanah Loloa, moving from the town where she grew up in New Zealand to start a new life in Australia was an experience both exciting and stressful. It was hard leaving all her friends and trying to make new ones but, eventually, Raelanah and her family were able to build a new life in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Raelanah Loloa, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Old ground new ground school ground
results.creator_credit: John Nicoll and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: An interview based documentary in which six Melbourne school students from non-English speaking backgrounds talk freely about themselves, their feelings and aspirations, and their experiences in Australian schools and Australian society.
